      • makeSameLengthArray

        public int[] makeSameLengthArray(int[] a,
                                 int[] b)
        Makes a bigMath number the same length as another if it is smaller by adding zeroes to the beginning of it.
        Parameters:
        a - the first number being compared
        b - the number it's being compared with.
        Returns:
        the padded number or do nothing if they are the same length.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • multiplyNorm

        public int[] multiplyNorm(int[] a,
                          int[] b)
        Long-Multiplication of one number array by another and returns the result. Got help from Matthew Crumley @ silentmatt.com.
        Parameters:
        a - the first number in the multiplication equation.
        b - the second number in the multiplication equation.
        Returns:
        the answer as a new BigMath number.

      • multiplyKarat

        public BigMath multiplyKarat(BigMath secondBig)
        Karatsuba multiplication return "this" multiplied by another BigMath number.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the second number in the multiplication equation.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

      • karatsubaMultiply

        public BigMath karatsubaMultiply(BigMath x,
                                 BigMath y)
        Not finished yet. Multiplies two numbers using Karatsuba algorithm. Code taken from introcs.cs.princeton.edu. no author.
        Parameters:
        x - the first number to be multiplied.
        y - the second number to be multiplied.
        Returns:
        result after multiplying x and y.

      • shiftLeft

        public BigMath shiftLeft(int n)
        Returns a new instance of the shifted number. Which is needed because I can do calculations by shifting left without having to change the original number being shifted.
        Parameters:
        n - the amount of times the number should be shifted.
        Returns:
        the shifted number.

        public int bitLength()

        Returns:

      • modSlow

        public BigMath modSlow(BigMath secondBig)
        Slow algorithm to find remainder when dividing two numbers. It works by subtracting until we reach zero, once it can no longer pass zero, it will count the remaining numbers and return the remainder.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor which will divide the divendend.
        Returns:
        the answer as a BigMath number.

      • modSlow2

        public BigMath modSlow2(BigMath secondBig)
        Another slow algorithm to calculate modulo. This method just passes the arrays of the objects into remainder() to make it easier for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor.
        Returns:
        the remainder.

      • remainder

        public BigMath remainder(int[] dividend,
                         int[] divisor)
        Uses the simple equation ((remainder = a - (a/b)*b)) to calculate the remainder.
        Parameters:
        dividend - the number that will be divided by the divisor.
        divisor - the number used to divide the
        Returns:
        the remainder once calculated.

      • divideSlow

        public BigMath divideSlow(BigMath secondBig)
        This is a slow division algorithm. This method just passes on the BigMath number arrays into divideSlowArray() to make it easier for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor.
        Returns:
        the quotient without remainders.

      • divideSlowArray

        public BigMath divideSlowArray(int[] a,
                               int[] b)
        Slow division algorthim that works by subtracting the divisor from the dividend until we reach zero while counting each time we subtract and recording it as the quotient.
        Parameters:
        a - the dividend that will be subtracted to zero.
        b - the divisior that is used to bring the dividend to zero.
        Returns:
        the quotient after counting how many times subtracting was done.

      • mod

        public BigMath mod(BigMath secondBig)
        Main mod algorithm that works using long-division. This method just passes the BigMath arrays to divideByArray() to make it easier for testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor used in the calculation.
        Returns:
        the remainder as a BigMath number.

      • modArray

        public BigMath modArray(int[] dividend,
                        int[] divisor)
        Divides two numbers using long-division and returns the remainder as a BigMath number. It works by breaking the dividend into smaller numbers and dividing them by the divisor. This makes computational calculations faster.
        Parameters:
        dividend - the number that will be divided by the divisor.
        divisor - the number that divides the dividend.
        Returns:

      • divideBy

        Returns "this" divided by another BigMath number.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

        Parameters:

        divisor - the divisor.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

      • modFast

        public BigMath modFast(BigMath secondBig)
        Another mod algorithm used to calculate "this" mod another BigMath number.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the divisor.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

      • modFastArrays

        public BigMath modFastArrays(int[] dividend,
                             int[] divisor)
        Performs a logical modulo using long division.
        Parameters:
        dividend - the dividend as an integer array.
        divisor - the divisor as an integer array.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

      • modBigInt

        public BigMath modBigInt(BigMath secondBig)
        Uses BigInteger's mod algorithm to find the answer of a modulo.
        Parameters:
        secondBig - the dividend.
        Returns:
        the answer as a new BigMath number.

      • knuthMod

        public BigMath knuthMod(int[] u,
                        int[] v)
        Modulo algorithm to calculate a BigMath number "mod" another BigMath number. Based on the Knuth's Algorithm D in "The Art Of Computer Programming Volume 2".
        Parameters:
        u - the integer array that represents the dividend.
        v - the integer array that represents the divisor.
        Returns:
        the result as a new BigMath number.

      • basePow

        public int[] basePow(int base,
                     int power)
        Calculates BASE (which is 10 in BigMath) to the power of a number.
        Parameters:
        base - the base of the power.
        power - the exponent.
        Returns:
        the result as an integer array.

      • toRawString

        public java.lang.String toRawString()
        Returns BigMath number as a string. This was needed because the other toString() method returns "BigMath" infront of the number. This one just returns the raw number as a string.
        Returns:
        the BigMath number as a string.

        public int intValue()
        Turns BigMath to Java integer.
        Returns:
        the BigMath number as an integer.

        the integer array.
